column4: Alright, if so could walk me through this it would be AWESOME.
I have a CDROM in drive E of my computer, which currently runs Win98
The Win98 is glitchy as a ll hell
So I'm trying to install Ubuntu off a CDROM
I told it to boot from  CDROM in Bios, which did not work
drive E ? :s
Allegedly
what should it be? :(
oh, you are talking about Windows drives ... confused me for a moment. :)
yea, sorry
how did you burn the CD?
so if you open the CD for reading, do you see a bunch of files ?
I havn't opened it for running, should I try in Windows? I've been trying to boot from it.
I'd check the contents of the CD first
Alright....
just name a few files/folders that you see
The file is called "ubuntu-9.10-desktop-i386.iso. It does not open. Does that mean I did it wrong?
that is on the CD?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BurningIsoHowto
then as far as I can tell, you did it wrong. =)
tried it, I'm on a school computer and DiskUtility is locked
try booting it then =)
